visuals.title: Linearity: Scaling and Addition in Time = Scaling and Addition in Frequency
visuals.description: If x(t) has coefficients X_k, then ax(t) + by(t) has coefficients aX_k + bY_k. The FS is a linear operation.

visuals.title: Linearity in Action: Spectra Add
visuals.description: The spectrum of x(t)+y(t) is the sum of their individual spectra. Each harmonic adds independently.

visuals.title: Time Shift: x(t) vs x(t  t)
visuals.description: Shifting a signal in time delays all features without changing the shape. The magnitude spectrum remains identical.

visuals.title: Time Shift  Phase Change: X_k  X_k  e^{jkt}
visuals.description: A time shift adds a linear phase kt to each coefficient. Higher harmonics get more phase shift.

visuals.title: Interactive: Shift a Signal and See the Phase Change
visuals.description: Slide the time delay t. Watch the magnitude spectrum stay constant while the phase spectrum tilts linearly.

visuals.title: Time Reversal: x(t)  x(t) Reverses the Signal
visuals.description: Time reversal flips the signal. In the frequency domain, X_k  X_{k}: the coefficients reverse their index.

visuals.title: Time Scaling: x(at) Compresses in Time, Expands in Frequency
visuals.description: Compressing a signal by factor a in time expands its spectrum. The new period is T/a and  becomes a.

visuals.title: Time Scaling Effect on Frequency Axis
visuals.description: Compressing by a=2 doubles the fundamental frequency. Harmonics spread further apart on the frequency axis.

visuals.title: Summary: Key Fourier Series Properties
visuals.description: Linearity, time shift, time reversal, and time scaling  the four essential FS properties.

visuals.title: Interactive: Apply Properties Step by Step
visuals.description: Choose a property (shift, scale, reverse) and apply it to a signal. Watch both time and frequency domains update.
